title: [K-12] Culturally Integrated Educational Design for Enhancing Multicultural Competencies

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Understanding of Multicultural Society and Online Learning Tool Usage Experience
context.additional_context: Project-Based Learning Aims to Cultivate Competencies for Effective Collaboration and Problem-Solving in Multicultural Settings, with Learners Designing and Evaluating Intercultural Communication Strategies

learning_goals: Learners will explain the holiday cultures of three countries (Korea: Seollal/Chuseok, Mexico: Día de los Muertos, Japan: Matsuri) according to a comparative analysis table and submit two or more multicultural education activity designs (e.g., role-play, experiential booths) achieving at least 70% on a rubric (content relevance 40%, creativity 30%, feasibility 30%).

Learners will design a 4-week educational program (three themes, five activities) applying the three-stage cultural integration model (awareness-acceptance-collaboration) based on multicultural learner needs survey results (20 surveys, 5 interviews).

Learners will develop a 5–10-minute digital educational content prototype comparing three or more cultures (e.g., Korea, Mexico, Nigeria) using collaborative platforms like Padlet or Google Jamboard and achieve an 'Excellent' grade in four out of five peer evaluation rubric criteria.
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
